folder: Richmond Terrace & Faber Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
2180 Richmond Terrace, adjoining the S. W. corner of Faber Avenue, showing the house of the Knights of Columbus, Assumption Council 1694. In 1874 the house was located on property owned by J. F. H. King; in 1898 it belonged to Mark Samuels; in 1907 to Florence W. Sweet, and in 1917 to Walter Sweet. Dates refer to maps on which the owners' names appear.

July 2, 1932

P. L. Sperr
title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Faber Avenue
